Package com.fudan.sw.dsa.project2.bean

Class MinHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fudan.sw.dsa.project2.bean.MinHeap
  • class MinHeap
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an auxiliary data structure that maintains a minimum heap. The heap is used in the dijkstra algorithm in the process of searching the path.
    Author:
    Wang, Chen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> heap
      The objects of the heap is stored as an array list

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MinHeap​(java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> elements)
      Constructor that keeps a copy of the original array list in the class variable and builds the heap after initialized the array list

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      (package private) void buildMinHeap()
      The elements in the subarray heap.subList(heap.size() / 2 + 1, heap.size() - 1) are are all leaves of the tree, and so each is a 1-element heap to begin with.
      (package private) Vertex extractMin()
      This method gets and removes the head element from the heap.
      (package private) boolean isEmpty()
      The status of the heap is identical to the array list
      private void minHeapify​(int i)
      The core method of the heap that maintains the array list a valid minimum heap, it is a recursive method that makes the requested node's left child and right child in order.

    • Field Detail

      • heap

        private java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> heap
        The objects of the heap is stored as an array list

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinHeap

        MinHeap​(java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> elements)
        Constructor that keeps a copy of the original array list in the class variable and builds the heap after initialized the array list
        Parameters:
        elements - Here the vertices in the graph

    • Method Detail

      • buildMinHeap

        void buildMinHeap()
        The elements in the subarray heap.subList(heap.size() / 2 + 1, heap.size() - 1) are are all leaves of the tree, and so each is a 1-element heap to begin with. The procedure buildMinHeap goes through the remaining nodes of the tree and runs minHeapify on each one.

      • minHeapify

        private void minHeapify​(int i)
        The core method of the heap that maintains the array list a valid minimum heap, it is a recursive method that makes the requested node's left child and right child in order. After the modification, it also recursively calls itself on the smallest child so that the sub tree can get maintained.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the element

      • extractMin

        Vertex extractMin()
        This method gets and removes the head element from the heap. After extraction, it moves the last element to the top of the heap and heapifies the entire heap.
        Returns:
        The head, i.e. the minimum element of the heap

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        The status of the heap is identical to the array list
        Returns:
        true if the array list is not empty or false if the array list is empty
